page.title: 15SALISBURY PLAIN "BARROWS"
page.content: There are many types of "Barrow" - burial mounds - in this area. {King and Queen barrows}were used for the burial of royalty or V.I.P's.{ {Long barrows}were used to bury many people and measured 100 ft. long. { {Round barrows}were of three types: { Bowl:}a small inverted shape for one person. { Bell:}a shallow hand-bell shape used to bury warriors. { Disc:}a tiny hump surrounded by a circular bank and used to bury women. Radioactive materials have dated these barrows between 4000 BC and 2000 BC. They were made of stone or wooden structures and covered with rubbly chalk. Today these barrows are covered over by grass and wild flowers and sometimes fenced for protection.
